travel_description: Click on any visited country to acces information and recommendations for your travels
serena_description:
Serena is a holistic and medical wellness center located in Malacatos, Ecuador.

The website showcases its ancestral therapies, modern treatments, and integrative approach to healing, with clear access to services, therapies, and contact details. It has three pages: Home, About Us and Services.

It was developed in a week using Wordpress Elementor as CMS and Hostinger for hosting and DNS.
viva_description:
VIVA is a real estate agency based in Malacatos, Ecuador.

The website allows visitors to explore available properties, learn about the area, and contact the agency through a modern and easy-to-navigate interface.

It was developed in a week using Wordpress Elementor as CMS and Hostinger for hosting and domain.
sumaj_description:
Sumaj Hoteles is a hotel group located in Tarapoto, Peru.

The client had already hired a local hosting serviced which included cPanel's CMS SiteBuilder.

The website was developed in a week and presents its eco-friendly accommodations, reservation system, and local experiences in a welcoming and informative design.
lab_introduction:
I've worked more than 6 years as a software developer for multiple companies. This helped me develop a lot of skills and experience.

I learned many languages and tools but more importantly I adquired many soft skills and strengthend my adaptability skills.

Now I'm on a journey to become a nomad freelancer and work on projects which I'm really passionate about. I aspire to develop more artistic skills and to become a better storyteller.

My main goal is to shorten the gap between low resources and technology all around the world.
volunteering_title: Get the most out of travelling
volunteering_intro:
You can travel all around the world while meeting amazing people, learning tons of things and save a lot of money.

For me it was one of the best decisions I've ever made. Volunteering allowed me to travel around many countries and meet amazing people. I learned many new skills and even more things about myself and life itself.

I once heard that travelling is the school of life.. and I've been proof of that. I strongly believe volunteering is the best way to travel. Either your do it alone or with a partner.
volunteering_benefits:
Like everything in life, volunteering may not be right for everyone. It takes a lot of courage to move through different places where you don't know what or who awaits you. There's a high level of uncertainty that constantly tests your willpower.

Self-discovery.
By constantly dealing with unfamiliar people and in environments that are out of your control, you learn to adapt and new skills flourish.
That's why, if you think you couldn't do it, I recommend it even more. You'd be surprised how much you can discover about yourself! The worst that can happen is that you don't like it and return to your safe place. But you'll have tried, and you'll surely have learned something new.

You save A LOT of money.
Most volunteer opportunities offer room and board, which are the two most expensive things when traveling. Not only that, but many volunteer opportunities can open doors to new projects and collaborations, for which you'll even end up earning extra money.

You make a LOT of friends.
Of all the times I've traveled so far, volunteering is where I've made the most friends. It feels great to know that there are places in different parts of the world where there are people who would welcome me.
Imagine everything you can learn (and teach) by making friends with people from cultures completely different from your own.

You'll have INFINITE anecdotes to tell.
There's not much more to say about this... just that if you're open to the experience, crazy and fun things can happen to you.
